name: Bahamian Mahi Mahi
author: Fil Nutter, Jr.
summary: This is an authentic Bahamian recipe I was given on Bimini many years ago. This goes well with a nice salad, garlic bread and a bottle of good German white wine. If you like fish you will not have any leftovers!
directions: Arrange the fish fillets in an oven proof 9x13 glass baking dish
Pour the rum and lime juice over the fish and place a slice onion on each fillet
Cover and refrigerate for 2 to 4 hours
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Remove fish from the refrigerator and pour off about 3/4 of the liquid
Leave the onion slices in the dish and place a thick slice of lemon on each fish fillet
Sprinkle with oregano and black pepper to taste
Place a pat of butter or margarine on each fillet
Bake, covered, at 350 degrees F (165 degrees C) for about 20 to 30 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork
Be careful not to over cook the fish or it will be dry
Serve with the cooked onion and lemon slices
